issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: On a resource detail page, when trying to add a "Name" tag, the page refuses to do so without any error messages

status.description: This issue has been validated/reproduced, but has not been prioritized yet.
status.name: Confirmed

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: Even though the resource name is in the title, it should still be in the list of key'value pairs, and for resources where that is editable it should be editable in the Name field (even if the implementation is via tagging). Thanks!
fields.summary: Detail pages for resources should allow "Name" tag editing as a form field

comments.body: [~jloza]: To clarify, the resource name, if it's handled via a "Name" tag, should display in the list of tags, right?  And we should display an editable "Name" field for resources where the name is defined in the "Name" tag, correct?

[~kgill], I will call you today to discuss this. I thought we had several options to choose from based on discussions we had way back when, so let's go through them and figure out which one we think is best!

Capturing notes from a discussion with [~jloza]…

Resources whose names are managed via tags should allow the "Name" tag to be editable as a form field, and they should *not* display the "Name" tag in the list of tags, with exceptions noted below… 

Security groups
- The "name" attribute isn't editable for a security group, so we should not create an editable form field for the "Name" tag, and we should display the Name tag in the list of tags.

Hey [~Rocky]: This is probably a good one to work on to become familiar with our code base, since it touches many of our resources across the site.  Let me know if you want to sync up when working on this.

[~Rocky]: While you're working on this, we also need to add a restriction on the number of tags a user is allowed to add for a given resource.  The limit is 10 tags (key/value pairs).

The tag editor template is at https://github.com/eucalyptus/koala/blob/develop/koala/templates/panels/tag_editor.pt and the JS is at https://github.com/eucalyptus/koala/blob/develop/koala/static/js/widgets/tag_editor.js
The limit warning should be displayed using an ng-if="tagsArray.length > 10" statement that wraps the tag input at https://github.com/eucalyptus/koala/blob/develop/koala/templates/panels/tag_editor.pt#L18

HTH,
Kamal

[~kgill], [~Rocky] Please note, that this fix affects all automated sequences. The tests click on element "link= name" to access the detail page, and also for resources with IDs like security group, instance, etc I use the resource landing page to parse that ID out from HTML.  Please create a branch from https://github.com/eucalyptus/se34euca/tree/master/selenium_ide/KOALA and run sequences INSTANCE_OPERATIONS.html , IP_OPERATIONS.html, KEYPAIR_OPERATIONS.html, SECURITY_GROUP_OPERATIONS.html, VOLUME-OPERATIONS.html to verify that the fix does not break the automated tests.
[~Rocky] Note that this has been punted to 4.0.1

Why was this punted to 4.0.1? It definitely *is* a regression (I read back in y'all's IRC discussion from last night where you thought it was not a regression, sorry I was already gone for the day and missed that, darn time zones!). Editing the name of a resource was done in 3.4.x via the "Manage Tags" dialog, as shown in the attached screenshot of 3.4.2. 

I strongly disagree with punting this. [~viglesias] [~kgill] [~tjcramer] can we discuss this one please?
I believe the consensus was that there is a workaround so this can still be punted.
[~jloza], [~alice] [~kgill], I have no problem putting this back into 4.0, just prioritize it appropriately.

[~jloza], [~alice]: AFAICT, this would only affect the instance, volume, and snapshot detail pages.  Since the landing pages for those resources only use ids for each tile, implementing this should not affect automated tests.  Assuming that's true, the remaining question is whether or not the manual testing burden is too great at this point if the instance, volume, and snapshot detail pages have the additional form field for the Name tag.
I'm helping QA with 4.0 and am more than happy to take on the test burden for this one, so no worries!

Pull request at https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/539

[~jloza] Note that simply "x"-ing the Name tag isn't enough to empty the name from the resource, since the Name form field will override that behavior.  So, to properly remove a Name tag, the Name form field must be emptied.

[~kgill], thanks for doing this! Nice job.

However, when creating the resource (i.e. volume), the name is implemented as a tag behind the scenes of course but it is not shown as a tag in the dialog. That is the desired behavior for the detail pages as well (don't show the name as a tag in the tag area, just show it as the form field), please. Otherwise you encounter the confusing behavior you noted with the x-ing of the tag being overridden by the form field. 

Please check create volume panel as an example of desired behavior for consistency. Thank you!

[~jloza] The description you noted in this ticket indicates that we're keeping the "Name" tag in the list of key/value pairs… "Even though the resource name is in the title, it should still be in the list of key'value pairs".

Note that If we remove the "Name" tag from the key/value pairs and the user enters 9 tags, the "You cannot enter more than 10 tags" warning will display.  Would be happy to remove it from the tag list, but we may want to discuss this a bit more first.

[~jloza]: Could you clarify what dialog (on what page) you're referring to when you mention "...the name is implemented as a tag behind the scenes of course but it is not shown as a tag in the dialog"?

[~jloza]: I've implemented a possible solution for the Name tag clearing problem.  In https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/542 x-ing the Name tag automatically clears the Name input field.  Let me know if this is adequate from a UX POV for 4.0.

Hi [~kgill] when I mentioned the list of key/value pairs I was not referring to the list of tags, I was referring to the k/v pairs as shown for the other resource properties (label and string, or label and field if the value is editable). Just like we do on the create volume dialog, for example. Where name is a label and the name itself is contained within a text entry field. 

My point was that in other places in the 4.0 console (such as create volume as an example), we did not include the Name in the list of tags, but only as a key/value pair (label and text entry field). If you look at that page, you will see the name is not displayed as a tag when you fill in that text entry field. This is better UX, since as you saw having this parm in both places confuses users unnecessarily (which can often happen when design choices are made based on how something is implemented on the back end rather than how it is thought of by users, this is a tricky thing here that really highlights this kind of issue, so it's good we are seeing it and having this discussion, I think).

Please call me when you come online this morning after you read this so we can touch base and be sure we are on the same page. Thanks so much!

[~jloza] Thanks for clarifying the key/value pair confusion.  I had read that as tag key/value pairs.  Do we want to hide the "Name" tag from the list of tags in the tag editor?  I have implemented a workaround to clear the Name input field when the Name tag is removed, preventing unexpected "you cannot enter more than 10 tags" warnings if we hide the Name tag from the tag editor and there are only 9 tags displayed.  Let's discuss if this isn't adequate.

After a phone conversation with [~jloza], we're going to hide the Name tag from the tag editor on the instance, volume, and snapshot detail pages.  For the 10-tag limit warning, we're going to add code to detect if one of the tags is the Name tag to prevent head-scratching if that message is displayed when there are only 9 tags in the tag editor.
Hiding Name tag on instance, volume, and snapshot detail page in https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/545 (merged to develop)

Looking good! Except: I clicked on the volume to check its detail page, and that looked good, and then I went to the snapshots tab of the volume's detail page to navigate to the snap itself, and when I clicked the snap name in the tile on the volume's detail page it barfed. See attached screenshots.
Ack, the error on the snapshot page was due to a typo.  Fixed in https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/549 (sorry about that!)

verified name is now included in key/value pairs as editable field, for instances, volumes, and snapshots. 

verification done on mac osx 10.9.2, FF 27.0.1
